Evolutionary Operators#

There are three types of evolutionary operators for the three stages of simulated evolution; crossover, mutation and selection. These operators take a variety of parameters that can be passed as a dict to your chosen evolutionary algorithm. For the differential evolution algorithm, take a look at its page for a list of trial vector and target vector operators.

There are three types of operators used in evolutionary computation:

  • crossover

  • mutation

  • selection

Operators across all three types take different parameters and all operators have default parameters if you do not wish to tune them further. It is worth looking at the possible control parameters for your chosen operators as tuning the control parameters can have a significant positive effect on the performance of your chosen evolutionary Algorithm.

Crossover#

uniform_crossover(parents: list, n_offspring: int = 2, crossover_probability=0.5, **kwargs)#

Discrete.

npoint_crossover(parents: list, n_offspring: int = 2, n_points: int = 2, **kwargs)#

Discrete.

one_point_crossover(parents: list, n_offspring: int = 2, **kwargs)#

Discrete.

two_point_crossover(parents: list, n_offspring: int = 2, **kwargs)#

Discrete.

hillclimbing_crossover(parents: list, n_offspring: int = 2, crossover_probability=0.5, max_attempts=5, **kwargs)#

Discrete.

linear_crossover(parents: list, **kwargs)#

only takes 2 parents.

binomial_crossover(parents: list, crossover_probability=0.5, **kwargs) → Individual#

Performs binomial crossover between two parents. In differential evolution, the parents would be a list or Collection of iterables representing the individual (parents[0]) and trial vector (parents[1]).

Parameters:

  • parents (any iterable, list or Collection) – The two parents to perform crossover on.

  • crossover_probability (float) – The probability threshold for performing crossover.

Returns:

A single individual that represents the combination of the two input parents.

exponential_crossover(parents: list, crossover_probability=0.5, **kwargs) → Individual#

Performs exponential crossover between two parents. In differential evolution, the parents would be a list or Collection of iterables representing the individual (parents[0]) and trial vector (parents[1]).

Parameters:

  • parents (any iterable, list or Collection) – The two parents to perform crossover on.

  • crossover_probability (float) – The probability threshold for performing crossover.

Returns:

A single individual that represents the combination of the two input parents.

Mutation#

uniform_mutation(individual: Individual, mutation_probability=0.5, mutation_range=1.0, discrete_values: Optional[list] = None, **kwargs)#
random_mutation(individual: Individual, mutation_probability=0.5, mutation_range=0.5, discrete_values: Optional[list] = None, **kwargs)#
inorder_mutation(individual: Individual, mutation_probability=0.5, mutation_range=1.0, range_: Optional[tuple] = None, discrete_values: Optional[list] = None, **kwargs)#
headless_chicken_mutation(individual: ~cify.ec.individual.Individual, crossover_operator=<function uniform_crossover>, crossover_params=None, discrete_values: ~typing.Optional[list] = None, **kwargs)#

Selection#

elitism_selection(population: list, n_agents=1, **kwargs)#
random_selection(population: list, n_agents=None, replace=False, **kwargs)#
tournament_selection(population: list, n_agents=None, t_size: int = 3, replace=False, **kwargs)#
